body:
> Am I doing something wrong here? Is this a known issue?

I've not seen this issue come up before, I'm having a little trouble reproducing it on macOS 10.11.6.

Here is my sample page:

``` html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <title></title>
    <style>
      webview {
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
        right: 0;
        bottom: 0
      }
    </style>
  </head>
  <body>
    <webview src="https://googlechrome.github.io/samples/keyboardevent-code-attribute/" />
  </body>
</html>
```

If I then open the dev tools and run:

``` js
document.querySelector('webview').getWebContents().sendInputEvent({ type: 'keyDown', keyCode: 'Tab'})
```

I do see a message get logged by the page.

Is it only the `Tab` key that isn't working for you? Is your page not receiving the event or is the event data just wrong/incomplete?

> Taking cues from your response, I've put together a simple test to demonstrate this:

Thanks so much for this example, can reproduce it now like you reported 👍 

> It's interesting to note that when a key is pressed on a physical keyboard, the keyboard event contains event.key, event.code and event.keyCode. Using Electron's sendInputEvent, event.key and event.code are empty but I think this is the expected behaviour.

I think this might be the issue, perhaps the recent Chrome upgrade caused this to stop working because the event generated by `sendInputEvent` don't have the `key` and `code` set on them.

If I set those fields locally on master then I do see your example working as it did in 1.3.7 which is good.

@purplemass I've pushed up a branch named `key-and-code-on-sent-input-events` that updates these values on the events, would you be able to build and try it out and see if it works as expected for your usage?

@kevinsawicki thanks so much for looking into this and issuing a fix.

I've never built Electron on OSX before - doing that now but there are some very large dependencies (>2.5GB) which are being downloaded from S3. I'll get back to you with the results if the build is successful.

@kevinsawicki I can confirm that your fix in the `key-and-code-on-sent-input-events` branch works as expected and the tab key behaves correctly.

The `key` and `code` parts of the event are also sent in this version.
